title: Bone Names Quiz
description: Identify bones of the human body

questions.question: What is the largest and strongest bone in the human body, located in the upper leg?
What is the smallest bone in the human body, found in the middle ear?
Which bone protects the brain and forms the dome of the skull?
What is the common name for the clavicle, which connects the shoulder blade to the breastbone?
Which bone is commonly known as the kneecap?
Which flat, T-shaped bone in the center of the chest connects to the ribs and is also called the breastbone?
How many vertebrae make up the normal adult human spinal column?
Which bone in the forearm is on the thumb side and rotates around the other forearm bone?
What is the medical name for the shoulder blade, a flat triangular bone on the upper back?
Which bone is the only bone in the human body that does not articulate (connect) with any other bone?
How many pairs of ribs does a typical human have?
Which bone is the larger of the two bones in the lower leg and bears most of the body's weight?
What is the common name for the mandible, the largest and strongest bone of the face?
Approximately how many bones are in an adult human body?
Which group of small bones forms the wrist and allows for the complex movements of the hand?
